meanings.definition: A dislike or distrust of people in general.
meanings.sent1: The misanthropies of the recluse were evident in his refusal to interact with others.
meanings.sent2: She tried to overcome her misanthropies by volunteering at a local charity.
meanings.sent3: Despite his misanthropies, he found solace in the company of his loyal dog.
meanings.sent4: The politician's misanthropies were evident in his cynical view of society.
meanings.sent5: The misanthropies of the character in the story were a central theme, shaping his interactions with others.
